text:
Hello everyone,

Is there someone that can help me to know exactly how I should create contact and company through API so that the company created is detected automatically though HubSpot. Right now I am creating it through domain, but HubSpot is duplicating the companies. How can I solve this issue, what are the best practices/solutions to solve this problem? I need to store in my DB the id of the contact and company that are created on HubSpot on the same action.
Hello guys!
Does anyone know how to get the discount in HubSpot API for templates?
I'm trying to make a template for a quote and I simply want to find a way to display the total discount amount in the quote

{% set QUOTE = template_data.quote || mock_data.quote %}
{% set DISCOUNT = QUOTE.hs_discount %}

And then use this snippet:

{{ DISCOUNT }}
However, this does not work. Anyone?

Good morning everyone,

So we have custom objects we created on HubSpot which we want to display to the user on a customer portal. For example a course certificate exam name the user wrote and a total price of the exam the user wrote is some of the examples we want to display to the user. The provided data is stored in the HubSpot CRM under custom objects.

Is it possible to achieve the above using a customer portal?
Discounts are associated to line items
`lineItems[0].discount`
This will pull the discount for the first line item
Super possible, I would suggest setting up graphql to pull all this information
Ah I see! Thank you very much  <@U01QVR44MEY>
For sure
Perhaps you could help me further
Not to expect too much of your helpfulness!
Sure
(ignore the settings for the variable, it's just to add taxes to the final number...)
Now the problem is it doesn't show up at all.. I believe the for loop somehow is messed up
Any ideas?
Is LINE_ITEMS a variable?
Like this:
`{% set LINE_ITEMS = template_data.quoteAssociatedObjects.lineItems %}`
Total Discount is zero for me
This line is the problem
`{% set TOTAL_DISCOUNT = TOTAL_DISCOUNT + item.discount %}`
It looks like discount is a string not a number

Good day everyone,

Who here came to this issue when working with HubSpot Customer Portal and how do I resolve it:

:wave::skin-tone-3:  Hi! I don’t work for HubSpot but have done a lot of DNS work for email deliverability.

Just want to be clear what’s going on, are you trying to set up a custom domain for a HubSpot website?

If so, who do you use as your hosting provider?

Hello everyone.

Currently, I am looking for a co-working mate.
If you are interested in paid co-working style, please DM me.

Best regards!

Hi Harris, thank you for reaching out. I am not 100% sure which hosting provider we are using, but I did a search and saw HubSpot is using CloudFlare. I'll just need to confirm from work which one we are using.

Can I reach out to you tomorrow throughout the day if I found out the provider?

I’m more than happy to be a resource, HubSpot support may be able to help too.

At a high level, HubSpot has a domain that they are using to host your content. Separately, you have a domain that you control.

What you want to do — _I think, I’m not 100% sure what you’re doing_ — is to point your domain to where HubSpot is hosting your content.

So when someone goes to your URL, the CNAME record (which is with your domain host) is what points them to the content on HubSpot.

Does that make sense?

I would start with this article: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/domains-and-urls/update-your-dns-records>

So at the moment I'm just testing the portal on my development account on HubSpot. Do you maybe know where I can find this which you mentioned of that "HubSpot has a domain that they are using to host your content. Separately, you have a domain that you control."
not because if I do a search this contact not exist
tahnks for your response
Hey James! Can you elaborate a little? Any paid job opportunities should be listed in <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs>.
<@U03TVDT8C7P> I heard about a focusmate. Is that something similar?

Hi <@U01QVR44MEY>
Actually, I am trying to achieve offering users they can create their own landing page in HubSpot, but I want to restrict them at the same time.
Hey! I'm trying this code now, had to leave office for the day yesterday.
It worked!
I could kiss you
I spent days trying to figure this out.
THANK YOU.
